intro: Aegiphila steinbachii, commonly known as the mountain thyme, is a perennial shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, small, needle-like leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in high-altitude environments. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Aegiphila steinbachii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
